qas.question: A cardinal who does not hold the title of "bishop" may not do what?

answers.text: perform the functions reserved solely to bishops, such as ordination

qas.question: Cardinals who were not bishops have been promoted to Cardinal around the age of 80 since what year?

plausible_answers.text: the episcopal vestments and other pontificalia

qas.question: What is a cardinal who is a bishop entitles to wear and use?

plausible_answers.text: mitre, crozier, zucchetto, pectoral cross and ring

qas.question: What six items make up the episcopal regalia?

plausible_answers.text: perform the functions reserved solely to bishops, such as ordination.

qas.question: What may a cardinal who does not hold the title of "bishop" do?
What year were cardinals were were bishops have been promoted to Cardinal around the age of 80?

context: A cardinal who is not a bishop is still entitled to wear and use <b2_0>the episcopal vestments and other pontificalia<b2_0/> (episcopal regalia: <b3_0>mitre, crozier, zucchetto, pectoral cross and ring<b3_0/>). Even if not a bishop, any cardinal has both actual and honorary precedence over non-cardinal patriarchs, as well as the archbishops and bishops who are not cardinals, but he cannot <a0_0><b4_0>perform the functions reserved solely to bishops, such as ordination<a0_0/>.<b4_0/> The prominent priests who since <a1_0><b5_0>1962<b5_0/><a1_0/> were not ordained bishops on their elevation to the cardinalate were over the age of 80 or near to it, and so no cardinal who was not a bishop has participated in recent papal conclaves.
